node.title: Supreme Court rules against Guantanamo detainee seeking torture info
node.description: "We believe that their confirmation (or denial) of the information Zubaydah seeks would be tantamount to a disclosure from the CIA itself," Justice Stephen Breyer wrote for the majority.

node.title: Cricket World Cup: How it all works and who to look out for
node.description: New match-ups, old rivalries and world cup debuts will feature at the Women's Cricket World Cup in New Zealand.

node.title: Putin's dwindling options and isolation fuel fears about his next moves
node.description: Observers have noted that Putin has appeared uncharacteristically agitated, delivering meandering screeds and publicly lashing out at his aides.

node.title: Environmental Protection Authority to demand '100 times' more data on use of chemicals
node.description: The Environmental Protection Authority says it is working hard to fill big gaps in the regulation of chemicals but needs more funding.

node.title: Productivity should be concern for environmentalists and economists - NZIER
node.description: Poor productivity is hurting New Zealand's ability to address climate change, according to the Institute of Economic Research (NZIER).

node.title: UFC: Israel Adesanya on fame, freedom of expression and boycotting New Zealand
node.description: A world-class striker, an elite entertainer and an enigma on the mic - the mention of the name Israel Adesanya elicits a number of opinions from MMA fans.

node.title: Arizona Governor Doug Ducey says he won't run for Senate
node.description: He's the third popular GOP governor who has recently decided being a legislator isn't for him in 2022.

node.title: Suspect arrested in attacks on 7 Asian women in Manhattan
node.description: He is facing multiple charges, including assault as a hate crime.

node.title: Suspect arrested in case of attacks on 7 Asian women in Manhattan
node.description: He is facing multiple charges, including assault as a hate crime.

node.title: The issues the GOP may focus on Jackson's Supreme Court hearings
node.description: Jackson's confirmation hearings before the Senate Judiciary Committee begin March 21.

node.title: You've heard of the metaverse. Here's what it looks like.
node.description: An emerging virtual world could change how we work, play and do business. "You are not alone in VR," one believer says.

node.title: Melinda French Gates on painful divorce and taking a "different path"
node.description: After 27 years together, Melinda French Gates and Bill Gates announced their split last May.

node.title: Family travels over 600 miles for shelter amid invasion
node.description: "You start living in peace," the mom of three said, "and then the same happens again."

node.title: Fewer workers apply for jobless aid as layoffs fade
node.description: Some 215,000 people filed first-time unemployment claims last week, showing a strengthening job market as Omicron recedes.

node.title: Biden administration asks Congress for $32.5 billion for COVID, Ukraine
node.description: "Given the rapidly evolving situation in Ukraine, I anticipate that additional needs may arise over time," Shalanda Young, acting White House budget director, wrote in a letter Wednesday.

node.title: Video purportedly shows Holocaust survivors in Kyiv cursing Putin
node.description: The video, widely circulated on social media, is said to show them looking into a camera in a bomb shelter.

node.title: A new sign of the labor crunch: $20 an hour for babysitting
node.description: The average hourly wage for babysitters surged 11% last year, far outpacing inflation, according to a new analysis.

node.title: Satellite image shows Putin's alleged super yacht out of reach of sanctions
node.description: In new satellite imagery obtained by CBS News, the yacht can be seen docked in a port in Kaliningrad.

node.title: Former MMA champ Cain Velasquez shot at kin's alleged molester: Police
node.description: Authorities say he hit another man during a car chase. Supporters say he had to come to his young relative's defense. Officials call it a case of alleged vigilante justice.

node.title: Stanford women's soccer captain Katie Meyer, 22, found dead on campus
node.description: While not disclosing any details surrounding Meyer's death, the university said that grief counselors were available.

node.title: Helmet worn by Amelia Earhart on 1928 flight sells for $825,000
node.description: Amelia Earhart wore the cap on a flight across the Atlantic in 1928 and later lost it in a crowd of fans in Cleveland.

node.title: More human remains found in search for Tulsa race massacre victims
node.description: In1921, a White mob descended on the Black section of Tulsa and burned over 1,000 homes and destroyed its thriving business district.

node.title: Police searching for man with 12 warrants for his arrest
node.description: Police are asking the public for information to help find David Johnstone, who has 12 outstanding warrants for his arrest.

node.title: States start probe of TikTok's impact on young users' mental health
node.description: Government officials and child-safety advocates worry about TikTok's practices and computer-driven promotion of content they say can endanger the physical and mental health of young users.

node.title: China asked Russia to delay Ukraine invasion for Olympics -NYT
node.description: Chinese officials told Russian official not to invade Ukraine before the end of the Winter Olympics in Beijing, The New York Times says.

node.title: Health workers' strikes off after Employment Court grants injunction
node.description: Strikes by health workers planned for tomorrow and next month have been called off after an Employment Court ruled in favour of District Health Boards.

node.title: Russian, Belarusian athletes banned from Winter Paralympics, after all
node.description: The International Paralympic Committee changed its mind in less than a day after fierce pushback in light of Moscow's invasion of Ukraine.

node.title: Fuel and commodity prices on the rise as Russia hit with sanctions
node.description: It might be happening on the other side of the world but the economic shockwaves of the Russian invasion of Ukraine are reaching New Zealand consumers.

node.title: Ukraine: Russia expected to resort to siege tactics as UN demands withdrawal
node.description: An explosion has rocked a Kyiv railway station where thousands of women and children were being evacuated, Ukraine's state-run railway company says.

node.title: Mental health should be priority as cases surge among students - psychologist
node.description: University students feeling anxious and uncertain about the Covid-19 outbreak should try not to become totally preoccupied by the pandemic, a psychologist says. Audio
